channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024110200
item.description:
Report E-2024110200

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-30
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:09 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (LSL) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 2 gallons of Carboline Rust Bond FC Part A (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the boxes and a little on the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 2 damaged cans, and oil-dri will be placed into a 5-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024110037
item.description:
Report E-2024110037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-03
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 3, 2024, at 0533 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Shreveport, Louisiana regarding the release of Phosphoric Acid Solution. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 30 gallons of Phosphoric Acid Solution (UN1805, 8, III) from (1) 60-gallon plastic drum onto the trailer floor and outside pavement. The release was reportedly due to a puncture from a pallet, impacting a 17’ x 8’ area in the trailer and 7’ x 100’ area on the pavement. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum with the remaining product was placed into an overpack to move on with the client. Undamaged products were re-loaded and re-secured in the trailer. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (7) 55-gallon DF, which were then staged onsite by the contractor for proper disposal.
